questSteps.stepDescription: Use a cut sapphire on an oil filled bullseye lantern and light the saphhire lantern.
Climb down "Dark hole under tree" south east of the water altar in the Lumbridge Swamp
Climb down the hole to access Lumbridge Swamp Caves.
additionalStepInformation: If this is your first visit, Use the rope on the tree.
Highly Recommended: Equip a Spiny helmet/Slayer helmet to negate damage from wall beasts.
Use the movement ability like Surge or Dive to prevent the wall beasts from attacking.

questSteps.stepDescription: Run to the south east end of the cavern until you see jumping stones. Jump-across the Stepping stone to the south
Enter the Tunnel and make your way to Juna. Dismiss any followers and free both hands.
Talk to Juna in the Lumbridge Swamp Caves. You need to have your hands empty. (Chat 1•✓)
additionalStepInformation: If you've already completed The Chosen Commander. (Chat 4•~•1•✓)

questSteps.stepDescription: On the north side of the cavern near the entrance, Right-click Travel across cavern on a Light creature.
Mine a rock, craft the magic stone into a stone bowl.
Jump the Cliff to the east.

questDetails.StartPoint: Talk to Juna, deep inside the Lumbridge Swamp cave.
ItemsRequired: An oil-filled bullseye lantern (Can be easily obtained from the Lorehound (pet) if you have 50 quest points)
A second strong light source (another oil-filled bullseye lantern, or a Seer's headband)
A rope, if it is your first time accessing Lumbridge Swamp Caves, and you are not accessing it through the Lumbridge Castle entrance.
Recommended: 36 Thieving and Death to the Dorgeshuun for alternative lantern source
49 Crafting, if you wish to make your own lantern. You don't need these levels to replace the lens by a sapphire in an existing bullseye lantern.
Unlocking the swamp shortcut during The Lost Tribe for ease of getting to Juna.
Starting The Lost Tribe to access the Lumbridge Swamp Caves through the Lumbridge's kitchen tunnel and having a lit sapphire lantern can be used to avoid the other items required.
Spiny helmet/Slayer helmet to negate damage from wall beasts.
